content.webTitle: Morning Mail: South Australia fires, Queensland election, NZ quake, Kid Rock and Russell Crowe

fields.headline: Morning Mail: South Australia fires, Queensland election, NZ quake, Kid Rock and Russell Crowe
fields.bodyText: Good morning folks, and welcome to the Morning Mail – sign up here to get it straight to your inbox every weekday morning. South Australia fires • More than two dozen homes have been destroyed as South Australia’s worst bushfires since the 1983 Ash Wednesday blaze continue to rage in the Adelaide Hills, with dangerous weather conditions forecast for the next two days. • See how the day unfolded on Monday as firefighters battled to contain the fires, and the latest pictures from the bushfires. • State governments say emergency spending must be protected in any overhaul of disaster funding, after expressing concerns that a Productivity Commission report calling for better disaster preparedness puts emergency response funds at risk. • Follow all our bushfire coverage here. Australian news and politics • Queensland premier Campbell Newman is set to call a snap early election today, amid fears the LNP will suffer heavy losses to Labor in any poll.Qld early election. • Tony Abbott’s press office has been criticised after excluding journalists and camera crew from his surprise visit to Iraq on Sunday. • Perth melted yesterday in scorching 44.4C heat, its hottest day in 18 years and described by the Bureau of Meteorology as ‘bloody hot. • US anti-vaccine activist Dr Sherri Tenpenny is planning an Australian tour in March, but protesters are urging the immigration minister to deny her a visa on character grounds. Around the world New Zealand’s South Island has been hit by a strong earthquake of magnitude 6.4 this morning that was felt across both islands. Liberia appears close to beating Ebola, with plans to reopen schools next month as figures show the infection rate has dwindled to just over four cases a day. An Indonesian naval patrol vessel has found what could be the tail of the crashed AirAsia passenger jet, the section were the crucial black box voice and flight data recorders are located. Oil price dips below $53 a barrel, intensifying fears about a slowdown in the global economy. Japan’s habitual New Year killer has struck again, after nine people were reported to have died in recent days from choking on rice cakes. More from around the web • Among the most read on the Guardian this morning: Kid Rock writes in an opinion piece, ‘I’m not just wealthy, I’m loaded’ • Australia’s chief executives want urgent changes to how the Senate is elected and longer terms for the House of Representatives, the Australian Financial Review reports. • Seven out of 10 Australians believe we should remain neutral in any armed conflict between China and Japan over the East China Sea islands, The Australian reports. • The Napthine government’s ad blitz to promote its transport plans cost Victorians more than $15 million, The Age reports. • As Queensland premier Campbell Newman prepares to call a snap election, The Courier-Mail reports that Labor has pledged to scrap some of Queensland’s controversial bikie laws if it wins government. One last thing Russell Crowe is facing a barrage of criticism after telling female actors they should stop complaining about a lack of good roles and act their age. Women his age in Hollywood miss out on roles because they insist on being cast as 21-year-old ingenues? What a load of old hat, writes Nosheen Iqbal. Have an excellent day – and if you spot something I’ve missed, let me know in the comments here or on Twitter @earleyedition.
